leave first things first are you a cat
person in real life we had cats growing

but we had had a cat sort of yeah until
I was like 15 at home me and Bob got on
really well he came around to my house
like about a few weeks before we started
filming and we and then and then he'd be
we just got on really well and then in
the dressing room in the day like I'd
bring my guitar in and he'd be sitting
in my guitar case having a little rest
and um yeah we' got really well James
was brilliant at kind of um you know
it's quite hard to sort of like get a
cat that you know knows you so well to
then be comfortable with just nipping
onto someone else's shoulders while they
walk around a busy London Street but
James it was incredible and you know
we'd have these little things like put
Bob on my shoulders and then we'd go for
a little walk up and down and after we
did that Bob would then realize I was a
safe person to stand on and be
comfortable and sit on my shoulders and
yeah it was just little funny little
things like that that's incredible cool
you can't even get like a dog to do that
and they're easily trained well yeah I
don't know Bob's just very uh very
receptive I mean he was just he he had
his eye on the prize didn't he he wanted
to be on the poster he was he was going
to get involved in that film so you knew
this was his shot it was his shot yeah
his make or break deal um because what
sometimes actors have to do a chemistry
test with another actress or actor do
you have to do a chemistry test with Bob
to see before no I went it wasn't meant
to be Bob in the film even it was going
to be four four cats which which also
are in the film as well there were other
sort of cats which were trained for
things like jumping on a bus and and the
stunts basically and and lots of things
and they were brilliant as well um with
brilliant handlers that trained them and
things um but then we found that yeah
just Bob having had the experience of
being around so many people in his life
was just very Zen and very cool and he
could sit down whilst people were
walking past on the pavement and not bat
an eyelid and um and that was amazing so
we we ended up using him a lot yeah oh
wow I just died when I saw him in a
scarf I almost cried in the screening
just then y did you want that he I mean
he's like he's a cute isn't he he's
lovely and he's just got a yeah he's it
was very cool it was weird because I
didn't know the book beforehand I wasn't
you know I wasn't like um if I'd maybe
known about their story for like some
people have sort of are just massive
massive fans and I I remember thinking
it's a bit like I don't have kids but I
imagine it's a bit like when people you
know see a baby they just don't even say
hi to the mom or dad do they go straight
for the baby oh I like that and walking
around with Bob on your shoulders it was
it was this like amazing sort of Beacon
coming off you and um and people were
just you know just blown away to see see
James and Bob walking around Covent
Garden they're kind of you know they're
icons of of Covent Garden now so yeah it
cool getting to know James was that did
that kind of make the story hit home a
bit more and well it I was already very
touched and moved and and and sort of
felt you know like it must have been a
very very hard journey that James had
gone on um from reading the script and
the book and then but having I sort of
it was weird before I met him before he
came around to my house I'd you know i'
watch loads of interviews with him and
sort of got this sort of idea a bit of
like who he was and what he might be
like and then but then for him to
actually come around and for us to have
I think the first night we spent like
five hours talking and playing guitars
and just you know hanging out basically
and he was just so open and and um and
up for kind of sharing things in details
about his life which maybe things that
weren't even in the book and um whatever
it was was that that I felt might be
helpful to know he was very um kind to
share really and he just wanted it to be
right you know he wanted the story to be
right and so I took every all the
information I could from James I also
went to um to kind of drug clinics and
addiction centers to speak to both
patients and doctors because you know
you sort of have to build up all angles
really to understand it I think some
people might be able to explain what
it's like for them from that point of
view but you know a doctor might be able
to give you a sort of scientif version
of what it is for you know what's
happening in your bloodstream at that
point when you're coming off something
you know and things like that which was
really useful to kind of get a handle on
you you you don't want to you don't want
to try and portray like addiction or
homelessness anything like that without
having a clear understanding of I think
otherwise there's a danger of just you
know generalizing it I had a very
important companion to help with my
second chance Second Time
Around okay look I'll take that off if
